"The Circular Ruins" is a short story by Jorge Luis Borges. The story is about a man who dreams of creating another person in his dreams. He goes to a circular ruins where he performs various rituals to create this person, and eventually, the person appears. However, the man soon realizes that he himself is a creation of someone else's dream. The story explores the themes of creation, reality, and the power of the human imagination. It suggests that reality may be nothing more than a dream, and that our perception of the world is limited by our imagination.
